text: Margaret Mary Heckler (June 21, 1931 - August 6, 2018) was an American Republican politician from Massachusetts. She served in the United States House of Representatives for eight terms, from 1967 until 1983 and was later the Secretary of Health and Human Services and Ambassador to Ireland under President Ronald Reagan. After her defeat in 1982, no woman would be elected to Congress from Massachusetts until Niki Tsongas in a special election in 2007. Heckler died at a hospital in Arlington, Virginia from a heart attack on August 6, 2018 at the age of 87. ==References== ==Other websites== * Doug Allan. “Speaker of the House: Joe Martin of N.
